citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Upon inspection, expired medications were maintained with other medications available for use in the facility’s pharmacy.
The medications had expirations, dating as far back as 2022 for antibiotics, pain medication, and antifungals.
Expired drugs may lose their strength and the effect of the drugs may be unpredictable, potentially leading to illness or
adverse impact of an animal’s health status. The facility must ensure the availability of appropriate facilities, personnel,
equipment, and services to comply with the provisions of this subchapter.

The facility did not have complete acquisition records. Required information was missing for eleven Lovebirds, two Red-
Rumped parakeets, seven common parakeets, and four rabbits.
The facility has not maintained complete acquisition and disposition records for one ferret and one opossum temporarily
housed at the facility. Acquisition and disposition records, including offspring born at the facility and all records of
disposition, are necessary to accurately track and identify animals being used in regulated activities, as well as aid in the
detection of movement of animals upon relocation to a new site.
The facility shall make, keep and maintain records that fully and correctly include all the required acquisition and
disposition information, including: the name and address of the person from whom the animals were acquired, the USDA
license number of the person if licensed or the vehicle license number and state and driver’s license number and state if
not licensed, the name and address of the person to whom an animal was given/sold, the date of acquisition or
disposition, the species of animal and the number of animals involved.

The refrigerator used for the sugar glider’s perishable food supplies had a bag of sliced apples that were molded.
Inopportune storage of food items can result in illness and compromise of health to the animals if other food items are
further contaminated by the spoiled produce. Supplies of food shall be stored in facilities which adequately protect such
supplies against deterioration, molding, or contamination by vermin. Refrigeration shall be provided for supplies of
perishable food.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a written environmental enhancement plan for the birds on-hand at the facility. Maintaining a
documented plan ensures adequate provisions are in place to suitably promote and sustain the psychological well-being
and needs of the avian species housed. An enrichment plan must be developed, documented, followed, and approved by
the attending veterinarian, in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and currently accepted professional
standards.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 11th 2024, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
